intro: Primula adenantha, commonly known as the alpine primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. Its leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Primula adenantha thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky soils.
